item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSLToday, Martin Luther King Jr.’s name has become...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverParty for Socialism and Liberation - PSL

Today, Martin Luther King Jr.’s name has become synonymous with the entire Civil Rights Movement, and that movement has been portrayed as just another chapter i...n the unfolding story of constant American progress. Unfortunately, he is rarely remembered for his evolving critique of the U.S. economic system, his dedication to uplifting the poor and his view that mass social movements were needed to continue to transform society.

The rapidly expanding movement used non-violent civil disobedience and the language of freedom to put a spotlight on the hypocrisy of the government’s Cold War rhetoric. At a time when the United States projected itself as beacon of democracy and individual liberty, the “Negro problem” became an international issue that demanded reform.

Thanks to a decade of tireless work, sharp confrontations and the physical sacrifices of millions—most of whose names will never be known—the civil rights movement succeeded at dismantling Jim Crow segregation.

After the Civil Rights Act was passed, Dr. King emphasized how far the country still was from real justice, asking, “What good does it do to sit at the counter when you cannot afford a hamburger?” He was ridiculed for trying to advance the political direction of the movement by calling for more direct action, and dealing directly with economic issues.

Dr. King was dangerous to the political establishment because he started to draw the connection between different struggles and unite them against a common enemy. We cannot protest the war in Afghanistan and forget the racist laws directed at the immigrant community; we cannot fight for women’s rights and not speak to the need for full equality for the LGBTQ community.

When we remember Dr. King, we should remember him not as a speaker at a rally or leader in a demonstration. He was a man attempting to connect the various forms of oppression into a single struggle against social injustice. The only way to remove that injustice is to remove the foundation from which it grows. So let us remember this leader of the Civil Rights Revolution by talking about what it will take to build the next American revolution.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: This Thursday, call or email the Aurora Civil Service Commission...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

This Thursday, call or email the Aurora Civil Service Commission and remind them that the community has had enough of racist killer cops patrolling our streets. No reinstatement for Jason Rosenblatt!

"Rosenblatt, who is also suing the city as a result of his termination, will argue his case beginning Jan. 21, and Marrero and Dittrich will argue their cases starting Feb. 1.

All three have asked for the hearings to be closed to the public, according to the City. There will be n...o public records available until the commission makes a ruling."

https://kdvr.com/…/petitioners-flood-aurora-civil-service-…/

item.title: Today, we honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr and his radical...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today, we honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr and his radical legacy.

When we remember Dr. King, we should remember him not as a speaker at a rally or leader in a demonstration. He was a man attempting to connect the various forms of oppression into a single struggle against social injustice. The only way to remove that injustice is to remove the foundation from which it grows. So let us remember this leader of the Civil Rights Revolution by talking about what it will take to build the next American revolution.

Read more here: https://www.liberationnews.org/remembering-mlk-html/

+4

item.title: Eliza Lucero is one of several leaders of the peaceful protest...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Eliza Lucero is one of several leaders of the peaceful protest movement which has demanded justice for Elijah McClain. For daring to challenge the impunity of the police she now could face as many as 31.5 years in prison.

Sign the petition to drop the political prosecution against Eliza and all the targeted protest leaders: http://www.denverdefense.org/petition

National Committee for Justice in Denver

Elijah McClain was murdered by Aurora police in August 2019. A mass peaceful protest movement demanded justice. Now the leaders of these peaceful protests face ...decades in prison for daring to challenge the impunity of the police.

Meet Eliza Lucero, one of the targeted activists.

Eliza, 23, grew up in a rural town in western Pennsylvania. She was encouraged to stand up against injustice from a young age. Her mom took her to her first protest at age 8, a march against mass incarceration.

Rampant poverty, racism, and anti-LGBTQ discrimination drove her deeper into activism. Eliza moved to Colorado in 2018 and quickly became involved in local community organizing, including for housing justice, women’s and LGBTQ rights, and immigrant rights; and against police brutality.

She has been part of the struggle for Elijah McClain since the early months following his death, helping to put on protests, speaking out at city council meetings, and bringing public awareness to his case.

Sign the petition to drop the charges against Eliza and all the targeted peaceful protest leaders: http://www.denverdefense.org/petition

See More

item.title: “We need a militant mass struggle, that type of struggle that...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“We need a militant mass struggle, that type of struggle that shakes this country to its core!”

Following Wednesday’s fascist storming of the Capitol building in DC which exposed the collusion between white supremacists and the Capitol police, PSL Boston member and public school teacher Nino speaks to a crowd at an emergency demonstration called by Boston Socialist Alternative outlining what it will take for us to address this fascist violence that Trump has emboldened.

“The only way we can have a chance for humanity is to have a working class, socialist revolution from the bottom up, that’s proleterian in character, that unites the Black, Latino, Indigenous, poor white workers, the 140 million people plus in this country who are poor or near poor and facing eviction!”

PSL Boston - Party for Socialism and Liberation

“We need a militant mass struggle, that type of struggle that shakes this country to its core!”

Following Wednesday’s fascist storming of the Capitol building i...n DC which exposed the collusion between white supremacists and the Capitol police, PSL Boston member and public school teacher Nino speaks to a crowd at an emergency demonstration called by Boston Socialist Alternative outlining what it will take for us to address this fascist violence that Trump has emboldened.

item.title: 2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

2020 PSL presidential candidate Gloria la Riva made this short documentary two years ago featuring heroes from the Rebel Army and other forces that liberated Cuba in 1959.

Gloria asks one man, a member of the Rebel Army, "how do you feel today, 60 years later?"

He answers, "We triumphed, we won. Look at all these boys [motioning to boys watching the parade]. They have a future. Before, they had none. Shining shoes, picking up rocks... Now, they can be a doctor, an engineer. ...That is the satisfaction of us completing our mission."

https://www.youtube.com/watch…

See MoreIn Cuba in January 2019, a Freedom Caravan of Rebel Army combatants commemorated the entry into Havana of Fidel and the rebel army on Jan. 8, 1959, cementing...

item.title: BREAKING — CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING — CO State Attorney General Phil Weiser has announced that the state will open a grand jury investigation into the killing of Elijah McClain.

This would not have happened without the determined struggle of thousands of people demanding justice in Elijah’s case.

That said, we MUST remain vigilant and be sober about the reality that grand juries are frequently wielded as a tool for elected officials to pass the buck—and in instances involving the police, that often m...eans shifting responsibility off of themselves for letting the killers off with a slap on the wrist.

We do not know at this point what AG Weiser’s motivations are and all possibilies are on the table.

The people can say unflinchingly what is required for justice to be served in Elijah’s case: murder charges for Nathan Woodyard, Randy Roedema, and Jason Rosenblatt. We demand nothing less. #JusticeforElijahMcClain

See More
